TopicTitle: Dawn of the Space Age - Jebnik 1 100km equatorial orbite issue

Articles.Content:
Hi,

I have issue to achive goal. Need to do an orbite 100Km excentricity 0 inclinaison 0.

I have done it but nothing append... How to validate this step ?

Need help... thanks a lot

Regards

Edited August 30, 2019 by Fredo2468
add tags
A common mistake is to be orbiting in the wrong direction. Are you sure you're heading the right way?

Looks like it is.  Both KER and the contract say 0 degrees.

Are you sure you have everything you need on the satellite?  I've missed the requirement for a part so many times.

 

What is the "Demi-Grand Axe: 700,000"?

Hi,

Thanks for yours replys.

>Are you sure you're heading the right way? 

I think the direction of orbiting is the right on . I'm the same as the guy on this video, and for him it is working :

>What is the "Demi-Grand Axe: 700,000"

English equivalent is "semi-major axis"

>Are you sure you have everything you need on the satellite?

Yeaa, perhaps I need antenna. On the video the guy had an antenna, but me I does't have one. I will try with antenna asap

Regards

Re,

Unfortunaly, this is exactly the same problem.

I become mad... I don't understand why the orbit goal can't be validate
Here is capture

Hi,

Can it be an issue with my construct ? When the rocket is splitting ?

When I edit mission, I can see rocket name : jebnik 1 (see capture).

Previous other check in the mission are with "current rocket" and not "jebnik 1"

When slitting stage, the last one is named "jebnik 1 sonde" ("jebnik 1 probe"). And the "jebnik 1" is the first stage witch is now a debrit (see capture below). May it be the issue ?
